data.title: Absolutely Amazing Collection of Plants
data.text: This is definitely a stop you should make while in Iowa's capital.  Whether your interest is bonsai, cactus, or tropical plants there are exhibits ready to attract your attention.  We have visited dozens of times, but the center has never missed having new sights.  My favorite this time was a garden of insect-eating plants.  Everything is inside, so every season is a good time to visit.  There is a new restaurant too which offers a great chance to relax.

data.title: Loved all the indoor flowers!
data.text: It's fall so the grounds probably were not as gorgeous as they are in spring and summer, but we really enjoyed all the indoor displays and especially the greenhouses.  Definitely worth the price of the ticket to get in!

data.title: Nice Botanical Garden
data.text: Was technically here for a wedding.  It is small, but nice, a good number of plants, but nothing really exotic.  Easy to get to, lots of parking.

data.title: Coleus abound!!
data.text: This botanical garden is just lovely. They boast the largest selection of coleus in the area. They certainly have many varieties and as a collector of such I had a difficult time not pinching a few plants!! There is a wonderful walkway over the water way which is 'planted' with canna, water lily and other water loving plants. The restaurant on site is very good, featuring fresh greens and local produce from the farmer's market.

data.title: Beautiful fall day and wanting to wslk
data.text: What a sweet surprise.  In Des Moines for work and wanted to go for a walk so myself and a friend decided to visit the Botanical Gardens.  Was afraid the frost would have ruined much but it was beautiful.  Wish we would have gotten their earlier and had lunch on their terrace.  It closed at 2:00 pm.  But enjoyed the beautiful gardens .  Sure you should go in all the seasons.  They had a beautiful items in their gift shop.

data.title: Immaculate gardens, nice to wind down
data.text: Beautiful inside tropical sphere with cactus as well, leading into an outstanding wet area with waterfalls. Additional gàrden areas extend further on walkways. Bonzai plant displays were interesting as well. Lots of butterflys. Nice cafe terrace overlooking the gàrdens. Relaxing for sure. Wish they sold plants.

data.title: Lovely place to visit
data.text: The botanical garden has a wonderful display of tropical plants.  Very relaxing place to visit. The garden room had lots of flowers in bloom, including many orchids.

data.title: I am the Group Leader of a Diamond Tour bus trip with 44 passengers.
data.text: This was our first stop on a 9-day bus trip and we all ABSOLUTELY loved it!  I cannot tell you how many pictures were taken of the awesome waterfall!  The only complaint I have is that the café was not staffed enough to handle to 2 buses that arrived at the same time and some of our people waited over an hour to eat.  Unfortunately for them, they did not get to see all the wonderful sites there.  Our group picture at the Living Wall was awesome also.  Recommend this as a MUST STOP for anyone traveling through.

data.title: Absolutely amazing!
data.text: We went in early October and it was breathtaking! Beautiful grounds inside and out. The ladies at the gift shop were very sweet.  I suppose it could have had more kid specific aspects, but my 4 young children did enjoy themselves.

data.title: Botanical Garden worth a visit
data.text:
The walk from downtown is fairly easy along the river, although there are no trees to shade your walk, so if it's hot drive it.  Parking is free at the Gardens.
$8 Entrance fee unless you have a membership to their gardens, and they also accept trade-out entrance fee if you are a member of some other gardens (prob need to check which other gardens--ours worked.)
The dome conservatory garden is well maintained with several park benches to sit and soak it in.  The outdoor gardens are lovely too, also not much shade though.  The water lilies are some of the best we've seen--not tons of them, but nicely done.
Didn't stop in the cafe.

data.title: Well done
data.text:
We have been to several botanical gardens and this is very well done.
Great, knowledgeable, staff available to answer questions.
Plan on staying for lunch.  Great food at a reasonable price.  Soups are Terrific!
Take your time and get lots of pictures both inside and outside.

data.title: Great place to visit.
data.text: There were plenty of beautiful flowers and plants to see. The dome and grounds provided places for many plants to flourish. A large pond had a variety of lily pad flowers that were intensely colorful.

data.title: Beautiful Garden and views!
data.text: Beautiful and educational and a great place to take your time and stroll through the gardens, take pictures and enjoy the view of downtown Des Moines!

data.title: The Best Botanical Garden
data.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Botanical Garden.  The trees, plants, flowers and waterfall in the Conservatory are spectacular.  The indoor and outdoor gardens are beautiful also.  Everything is so well-planned and laid out.  It's the best botanical garden we have seen and we highly recommend it.

data.title: Gorgeous Peaceful Stop
data.text:
Our group was passing through Des Moines and stopped here for an hour. 
This was a very nicely maintained botanical garden.

There were many sections to see and one hour was simply not enough time for anyone who enjoys gardens.

We will definitely visit again if we are in the area again.  I think the admission charge was $8.00.

data.title: Delightful botanic garden
data.text: From what my wife and I were told, this garden is fairly new.  It was a wonderful place to spend about 1 1/2 to 2 hours on a Sunday afternoon.  Nice displays both indoor handout.  In the dead of winter it would probably not be worth visiting given the small indoor display area, but during the rest of the year, stop by.  Also, if you belong to another public garden which has reciprocity, your membership to your home garden gets you in for free,  The folks at this garden have done a very nice job of creating a nice garden.

data.title: Lotus Blossoms Charm
data.text:
So sorry I forgot my camera. Recently added on to outside Botanical Garden charts shift from huge agriculture to a tiny bit of garden business. 
 Huge lotus blossom leaves in tasteful water garden make for fresh air and tranquility. 
Centrally located in an immaculate and proud city.

data.title: A great place to unwind and relax
data.text: This is one of the nicest botanical gardens I've been to.  The array of plants is amazing.  Everything is labeled with the species and generic names.  My son did a scavenger hunt that is for free for kids and he loved it.  I didn't think he would be interested in plants( he is all boy), but he really enjoyed himself.  The staff was super nice and spent the time to go over the plants for the scavenger hunt.  The layout of the garden was fantastic!  Between the the waterfall, the dome and the pond with fish, frogs and turtles, I felt like I wasn't in the city!  So beautiful!  I highly recommend it!

data.title: Bigger than expected
data.text: This is a very nice botanical gardens and much larger than I expected.  Visited with two kids.  There are activity sheets for children and there is a family restroom (albeit an autoflush toilet..but it was a nice clean single stall family restroom.)  The inside area of the gardens is warm, so short sleeves are a good idea on a sunny day.  Loved walking around the path outside.  Lots to look at and explore.  Short walk to other sights.

data.title: Another favorite of ours.
data.text: We hadn't been there for years because it wasn't very well run.   Now, with the new "director", things are getting cleaned up and kept clean.   We went 2 years ago in the fall, and many volunteer were there to plant something like 145,000 bulbs so we weren't allowed in the gardens.   however, the admission was dropped down because we got to see less.    We try to annually and sometimes more than once.   The dome has also been repaired.    Looks so much better.
